title: Project Manager (Mobile)
description: Rakuten is a global Internet and e-commerce company, with over 1.3 billion registered users worldwide. Our e-commerce platform is the largest of its kind in Japan and among the world's largest by sales. Rakuten has many subsidiaries, including well-known brands like Rakuten VIKI, Rakuten TV, Rakuten Kobo and Rakuten Viber.As a Project Manager in the Core Platform Section, you will be responsible for mobile marketing service development (web application and mobile software development kit), a core component of our digital marketing platform. Your team will have peers in Tokyo and Bangalore. In this distributed circumstance, the team will be driving many projects and operations for our AD/Marketing activities.Your day-to-day task will be stakeholder management (located in Japan, India and Singapore), requirement gathering, business  system KPI (Key Performance Indicator) analysis, project leading and entire development process/software life-cycle managements (including process management of technical software design, implementation, quality assurance, delivery and post-release production support). You will be expected to showcase your strong communications skills with stakeholders (like business and development team, including your reporting line,) while demonstrating a sense of ownership of the development project.Responsibilities:  Work closely with remote stakeholders to define proper project goals and business/functional requirements  Be engaged in the whole process of the development project (requirement gathering, technical software design, implementation, quality assurance, operation/maintenance notification to stakeholders) as the project manager  Work closely with the tech lead and other engineering persons to achieve project goals defined by you through streamline communication in English. Stakeholders are in Japan and India as well.  Find out business pain points through close day-to-day communication with business teams, and propose your solution to solve these issues  Capture improvement points based on KPIs and create/execute an improvement plan  Develop and maintain a deep understanding of systems, and propose system improvements aligning with your engineering team  Guide and support members as a mentor and be a role model to improve team productivity and achieve organizational goals togetherQualifications  Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills  English: Business Level or above (required)  Ability to build a strong working relationship between technical and non-technical staff  Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate and guide team members to cultivate good working relationships and achieve goals together  Strong skills and experiences to write spec documents  Strong skills and experiences to develop quality assurance plans and procedures  Basic knowledge on Computer Science, software development, and Mobile services  Strong interest in Marketing and Mobile  Knowledge of development methodology (Agile and Scrum)Preferred Qualifications:  Familiarity with the digital marketing industry landscape  Experience in KPI management including AD delivery and marketing activity performance evaluations  Experience in project management in software development  Work experience with distributed teams  Familiarity with project management tools such as JIRA, Confluence  Experience in web application development as a software engineerRakuten is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications regardless of sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age.

title: Software Developer
description: As a Software Engineer, you will be working on projects that are currently being developed by our company. Duties will include but are not limited to developing and directing software system validation and testing methods, as well as directing our software programming initiatives.You will:  Support the entire software development cycle, from design, develop, test and debug.  Oversee the development of documentation  Monitor system performance  Applying best practices and standard operating procedures  Creating innovative solutions to meet our company’s technical needs  Testing new software and fixing bugs  Shaping the future of our systemsYou have:  Diploma / Degree in Computer Science  Experience in Agile / Lean / Waterfall / Iterative / DevOps to support the Software Development Lifecycle  Experience in coding languages, JS, C# will be key  Experience in coding languages, Flutter and React will be bonus  Experience in CI/CD  Strong analytical and reasoning skills with an ability to visualise processes and outcomes  Outstanding all-round communication skills and ability to work collaboratively

title: Analyst Programmer / Systems Analyst (Digital Solutions Department) (2-Year Contract) [NIE]
description: The National Institute of Education (NIE) invites suitable candidates to join the Division of Academic Computing  Information Services (ACIS) as an Analyst Programmer/Systems Analyst on a two (2) year contract basis.The candidate should be a dynamic IT professional who is a good team player and a strong software developer.ResponsibilitiesAs a member of the Digital Solutions department, your responsibilities include:The Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) framework, encompassing:  Planning;  Define Requirements;  Design and Prototyping;   Software Development;  Testing;  Deployment;  Maintenance. - Collaborate with IT teams on implementation and deployment of applications.- Focus on good code quality and high-test coverage and participate in code reviews.- Integrate software components and third-party programs to meet specifications.- Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing applications.Requirements  A University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.  2+ years of experience as a software developer, software engineer, or similar role.  Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.  Robust knowledge of .Net coding language.  Experienced in software development/integration with APIs.  Relevant experience with databases and Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) frameworks (e.g., Hibernate).  Quick learner who is passionate and willing to learn new languages and technologies.  Good self-motivated team player with a positive attitude and flexibility in adapting to changes.  Ability to work with tight deadlines and fluid requirements.  Experience in managing IT projects independently is an advantage.  Knowledge in RPA (Robotic Process Automation) tool, UIPath, is an advantage.Other InformationNIE staff can take chartered buses at their own expense from or near their homes to NIE campus. This is subject to the availability of seats.Closing Date: 21 November 2021We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Project Manager (Mobile)
description: Rakuten is a global Internet and e-commerce company, with over 1.3 billion registered users worldwide. Our e-commerce platform is the largest of its kind in Japan and among the world's largest by sales. Rakuten has many subsidiaries, including well-known brands like Rakuten VIKI, Rakuten TV, Rakuten Kobo and Rakuten Viber.As a Project Manager in the Core Platform Section, you will be responsible for mobile marketing service development (web application and mobile software development kit), a core component of our digital marketing platform. Your team will have peers in Tokyo and Bangalore. In this distributed circumstance, the team will be driving many projects and operations for our AD/Marketing activities.Your day-to-day task will be stakeholder management (located in Japan, India and Singapore), requirement gathering, business  system KPI (Key Performance Indicator) analysis, project leading and entire development process/software life-cycle managements (including process management of technical software design, implementation, quality assurance, delivery and post-release production support). You will be expected to showcase your strong communications skills with stakeholders (like business and development team, including your reporting line,) while demonstrating a sense of ownership of the development project.Responsibilities:  Work closely with remote stakeholders to define proper project goals and business/functional requirements  Be engaged in the whole process of the development project (requirement gathering, technical software design, implementation, quality assurance, operation/maintenance notification to stakeholders) as the project manager  Work closely with the tech lead and other engineering persons to achieve project goals defined by you through streamline communication in English. Stakeholders are in Japan and India as well.  Find out business pain points through close day-to-day communication with business teams, and propose your solution to solve these issues  Capture improvement points based on KPIs and create/execute an improvement plan  Develop and maintain a deep understanding of systems, and propose system improvements aligning with your engineering team  Guide and support members as a mentor and be a role model to improve team productivity and achieve organizational goals togetherQualifications  Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills  English: Business Level or above (required)  Ability to build a strong working relationship between technical and non-technical staff  Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate and guide team members to cultivate good working relationships and achieve goals together  Strong skills and experiences to write spec documents  Strong skills and experiences to develop quality assurance plans and procedures  Basic knowledge on Computer Science, software development, and Mobile services  Strong interest in Marketing and Mobile  Knowledge of development methodology (Agile and Scrum)Preferred Qualifications:  Familiarity with the digital marketing industry landscape  Experience in KPI management including AD delivery and marketing activity performance evaluations  Experience in project management in software development  Work experience with distributed teams  Familiarity with project management tools such as JIRA, Confluence  Experience in web application development as a software engineerRakuten is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications regardless of sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age.

title: Software Developer
description: Xjera Labs (www.xjeralabs.com) is looking for Software Engineer that can fulfil the following requirements.Position SummaryThe ideal candidate is a self-motivated, multi-tasker, and demonstrated team-player. You will be a software developer responsible for the development of new software products and enhancements to existing products. You should excel in working with large-scale applications and frameworks and have outstanding programming skills. Fresh graduates with programming experience are welcome too!Essential Job Description:  Design and develop server-side software with high performance, high availability and high scalability for company.  Create easy-to-use, stable and reliable cloud products and services.  Write high-quality, clean, elegant, and maintainable code.  Understand the technical platform, constantly optimise the service, identify and fix problems, improve usability, stability and reliability.  Design and implement various supporting tools as needed.Required Skills  Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or a related field is required. Post graduate degree a plus, fresh graduates are also welcome!  In-depth understanding of computer science fundamentals: data structures and algorithms, operating systems, networks, databases, etc.  Strong and hands-on experience with C++.  Familiarity with Linux/Windows development environments and multi-threading programming.  Familiarity with common network protocols (TCP, UDP, HTTP) and network programing.  Solid OOP and software design knowledge – you should know how to create software that’s extensible, reusable and meets desired architectural objectives  Experiences in design and development of large-scale distributed systems. (preferred)  Experiences in middlewares development (distributed storage, cache, message queue, etc.). (preferred)  Experiences in web backend development. (preferred)  Familiarity with virtualization, container and orchestration technologies. (preferred)  Knowledge in server security. (preferred)  Contribution to open-source projects. (preferred)

title: Site Reliability Engineer (GCP/AWS)
description: COMPANY DESCRIPTION    NE Digital is the digital, data and technology organization that serve as a center of excellence to drive digital transformation for our group of NTUC Social Enterprises to meet the critical social needs of Singapore's community. Delivering innovative products and solutions, we empower our people to lead a better and meaningful life through digital services in the area of daily essentials, health and community care, childcare and education as well as financial services.The TeamWe believe that diversity is key to driving an innovative, cohesive, productive and fun workplace! Hence, at NE Digital our people join us from all around the world. Be sure to be soaked in an environment with different ethnic groups driving innovation and injecting some creative juice as one!Contributing to a social purpose through technology, our team of passionate and dedicated folks are spread into different social enterprises such as NTUC Fairprice Group, NTUC First Campus, NTUC Health and among others!Creating technologies that impacts!    RESPONSIBILITIES    A site reliability engineer (SRE) will spend up to 50% of their time doing "ops" related work such as issues, on-call, and manual intervention. Since the software system that an SRE oversees is expected to be highly automatic and self-healing, the SRE should spend the other 50% of their time on development tasks such as new features, scaling or automation. The ideal site reliability engineer candidate is either a software engineer with a good administration background or a highly skilled system administrator with knowledge of coding and automation. As a SRE in NE Digital, you will drive the initiatives to improve automation, scalability and reliability of our core services such as Fairprice Online, ScanGo, Identity, my first skool and much more. As a member of NTUC Enterprise Center of Excellence you will be exposed to the latest technologies with AWS Cloud, Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes, Kubeflow, ML/AI, Big Data, in Hybrid/multi cloud environment. We are strong believers in DevSecOps, SRE, Agile and FinOps.Roles  ResponsibilitiesWork with release engineers to ensure the DevSecOps pipeline is as efficient as possible.Collaborate closely with product developers to design solutions with considerations on availability, performance, security, and maintainability.Perform infrastructure as code with Terraform and Ansible.Support instances, container, serverless platforms to ensure scalability, availability and lifecycle, are under controlMaintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency, and overall system health.Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation; evolve systems by pushing serverless or container transformations.Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.Documenting tribal knowledge.QUALIFICATIONS    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field involving systems engineering, or equivalent practical experience.Experience in Unix/Linux and/or Windows operating systems.Experience in analyzing and troubleshooting systems.Understanding of Infrastructure monitoring, logging, alerting release and configuration management.Understanding of networking (e.g. TCP/IP, routing, network topology, load balancers, DNS, NTP).Experience in one of the following: Python, Go, Perl, Ruby or shell scripting.Experience in Public Cloud, AWS and/or GCP.Experience maintaining Internet-facing production-grade applications.Experience with software deployment and/or orchestration technologies, e.g., Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform.Experience in CI/CD (e.g., JIRA, Git, Jenkins, Nexus, ...)Experience in standard IT security practices (e.g., encryption, certificates, key management)Excellent communication, and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail.Flexibility to work non-business hours that may include weekends and/or holidaysSelf-starter who is able to identify and perform tasks with minimal supervisionExperience with GSuite apps (Gmail, Gsheet, Gdoc, ...)    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - NE Digital

title: Web/Mobile SDK Principal Engineer_21WD51656
description: Web/Mobile SDK Principal EngineerLocation: SingaporeJob ID: 21WD51656Position OverviewAutodesk is looking for a Principal Software Engineer to join a data team within Data Platform  Services (DPS). You will be working with Autodesk Data Platform Product Analytics (ADPPA), Product Data Capture team. This is a great opportunity to join a team that delivers both internal and customer facing applications and services that provide the data collection needs of all data scientists, data analysts and data engineers throughout the organization. You will have the opportunity to understand the entire data platform from product instrumentation through to business analytics, machine learning, and data-driven products.As a Principal Engineer, you will be joining a very talented and seasoned engineering team. You will have the opportunity to work with many new and exciting technologies and frameworks used in our data platform.We are looking for people who are as excited about data technology as we are. You can be part of improving quality of our products across all aspects of our core data platform and see your work drive the business.Responsibilities  Break down a large problem into smaller components and provide a clear solution for each piece  Recommend appropriate technologies to be used to achieve productivity and efficiency  Design and build reusable components, libraries, and tools for web to instrument and ingest product data effectively  Collaborate with Product Manager, Engineering Manager, and other stakeholders to deliver features according to agreed scope and schedule  Collaborate with QA engineers to define software testing strategy  Ensure the quality, performance, and compatibility of the product using test automation  Promote and accelerate the usage and integration of our component by conducting training sessions, providing support, writing clear product documentation, and troubleshooting issues  Provide guides and direction to other engineers on development processes and product architecture  Review source codes contributed by other engineersMinimum Qualifications  Excellent analytical and problem-solving skill  Extensive knowledge and understanding of JavaScript  Experience in writing JavaScript library modules with cross-browser compatibility  Solid understanding in HTML  CSS  Proficient in writing automated tests with any testing framework  Proficient in working with distributed versioning control system  Team player who is willing to help and collaborate well with other team members  Great communication skill (written and spoken)  Degree in computer science or related fieldPreferred Qualifications  Experience writing NodeJs library module  Knowledge in any of other programming language (Java/Ruby/Python)  Experience working with product analytics services (Google Analytics, Amplitude, Mixpanel, etc)About AutodeskWith Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

title: BankLync Senior Engineer
description: FinLync, we focus on solving the most pressing FinTech challenges facing the world’s largest companies. Our suite of elegant, easy-to-install apps give corporate finance and treasury departments complete, direct control of their data – in real-time.Founded by globally recognized leaders in treasury and cash management, FinLync evolved from a series of partnerships among the world’s leading corporations and financial institutions. Our products include a suite of SAP-and other ERP-native Apps that give treasurers and cash managers beautifully designed and instant (API-driven) cash management experiences, fully embedded in their existing ERP System.After completing a sizable fundraise from eminent investors, we are expanding our team to fuel our global growth. This will enable us to deliver on current commitments, improve our existing apps, and build out new products to meet the needs of the worlds largest financial institutions and corporations!In this role, you will be a hands-on product engineer, building innovative and category-defining applications for corporate banking. You will leverage your deep expertise but take a green-field and innovative approach to functional design. You will work with top talent developers to design and manage the build out of new maverick apps for bank’s new APIs.Working in an agile team responsible for developing and advancing Finlync's cutting edge multi-bank connectivity solution.Responsibilities:  Development, maintenance, and enhancement of various features within the FinLync API ecosystem.  Coordinate requirements and delivery with internal and external stakeholders.  Pro-active approach to software development, advocating for best practices and safety in every step of the pipeline.  Values context-awareness and data when making architectural decisions.  Represent FinLync in technical conversations with high-profile clients.  Self-organization and ownership of assigned projects.Qualifications:  At least 5 years of delivering production level software.  Extensive and proven experience as a software engineer using Node.js (preferably with Typescript).  Expertise in publishing and consuming various API specs, formats, and implementations.  Versatile experience working with various operating systems and cloud providers.  Experience with administration of highly available and distributed production systems.  Proficiency working with modern security standards and protocols.  Proficiency in networking and working with isolated networks.  Exceptional project management and organizational skills.A Plus, if you have experienced:  Interfaced with enterprise systems. e.g, ERP, SAP, Banks.  Working experience or Certification with AWS.  Deployed enterprise-level solutions to Fortune 500 companies.Being successful in this role:  Product-centric mindset and client obsession  Shipping quality software  Values accountability and ownership to get a project from inception to delivery with little to no regressions/introduced issues.FinLync is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status. If you have a disability and need assistance with our employment application process, please email us to obtain assistance.

title: DevOps/SRE Engineer (Junior/Senior)
description: COMPANY DESCRIPTION    One of the fastest growing telecom operators in the Asia-Pacific, MyRepublic has operations across Singapore, New Zealand, and Australia, and is set to expand further into the region.Our vision is to be the worlds largest enabler of deep, meaningful and trusted relationships between customers and products through a highly scalable connectivity franchise model.With our uniquely scalable and centralised framework enabling the seamless delivery of layered services, MyRepublic has become a leader in the digital transformation for the telecom sector, one that is set to play out over the next decade in one of the most exciting regions of the world.    RESPONSIBILITIES    MyRepublic is not just an Internet Service Provider. At MyRepublic, were passionate about building software that solves problems. The Platform Operations team builds and runs the BSS/OSS system - the heart of every Service Providers operations. Our systems are used around the region not just by MyRepublic, but also other Service Providers; millions of users depend on our BSS/OSS platform, thats why we count on our DevOps/Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) to ensure that our systems and processes are efficient, reliable, secure and performant. If you are someone who is passionate about developing real-world solutions, improving automation and operational efficiency and able to bring fresh ideas and unique viewpoints, we want you on our team!Who You ArePassionate, driven and creative at solving problemsCant sit still -- challenges keep you awake at nightAn all-rounder; have gone knee-deep in different areas such as Software, Systems, Infrastructure or NetworkA keen adopter and user of Open Source softwareGood communicator and writer (in English)What You Will DoA chance to build and run systems that millions of users depend onWork closely with developers to implement high quality, scalable and reliable servicesBuild, operate, maintain and scale the application infrastructureImplement CI/CD pipelines and other automation processesImplement and manage monitoring to collect metrics and improve reliabilityImplement automated security checks to improve code quality and platform security complianceQUALIFICATIONS    What You BringExperience as a DevOps, Site Reliability Engineer, or Software EngineerGood knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker/containers is essentialGood knowledge of CI/CD pipelines tools and applications, including writing or debugging pipeline scripts is required (Jenkins, GitLab experience is a plus)Good knowledge in Linux, including scripting and automation (Ansible is a plus)Good knowledge of Cloud service providers, ideally AWSGood knowledge of Cloud automation/management in AWS (Terraform is a plus)Knowledge of Databases, ideally Postgres and MySQLCoding knowledge beyond simple scriptsExperience in implementing test automation, linters, security scanners is a plusKnowledge of security standards such as PCI/DSS and ISO 27001 is a plusGood English communication and writing skill is a must    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - MyRepublic Group Limited

title: Sr Business Systems Analyst - 29246-JOB
description: All About UsDo you want to make a difference? Illumina’s mission is to improve human health by unlocking the power of the genome. If that inspires you, let’s talk. We’ve built a culture fueled by innovation, collaboration and openness, and established ourselves as the global leader in DNA sequencing and array-based technologies. Our people and our technology change lives by driving advancements in life sciences, oncology, reproductive health, agriculture and other emerging markets. We are deeply passionate about what we do, because we know that our work has the power to improve lives.We’re an established company with a track record of phenomenal growth. Our revenue grew from $10 million in 2002 to approximately $2.2 billion in 2015. Our growth isn’t just revenue, we’ve been hiring the best and the brightest. Perhaps that’s why MIT has ranked Illumina near the top of its World’s Smartest Companies list three years running, including #1 in 2014. If you thrive in a brilliant, fast-paced, and mission-driven environment, Illumina is the place for you – imagine the possibilities.Position Summary:Illumina is seeking a Senior Business Analyst for Manufacturing Execution System (MES). The ideal candidate will be the lead in the space who provides, vision and guidance to a team of analyst to drive design, development, test  deployment within our MES landscape. This is a hands on position which can that is primarily focused on providing functional guidance to less experienced software engineers onsite.  This is a Functional role directly responsible for  implementing solutions within Camstar, Illumina’s Manufacturing Execution System (MES). The overarching goal is to scale our MES landscape to stay ahead of rapid organizational growth.The individual will work with cross functional leaders to ensure solutions being deployed meet Illumina’s Quality Standards and industry best practices.  Candidate should be experienced in planning and leading execution of tactical development activities which are aligned to functional roadmaps.Responsibilities include requirements gathering, solutioning, testing and deployment efforts, creating solutions for organizational needs, identifying and delivering solutions for underperforming areas in Illumina’s design, supporting high priority sustaining activities and leading internal and external analyst and testers.Responsibilities:  Compile relevant information related to product and process definition, analyzing business and compliance requirements, assessing risks for impact, and procuring accurate information for use in global systems.  Own, support, and iterate models in Manufacturing Execution System (MES) to develop and optimize manufacturing process flows.  Drive improved utilization of MES for a manufacturing area with respect to both configuration and core functionality, and act as “voice of the customer” for manufacturing.  Understand master data and the roles played by PLM, ERP, MES, LIMS, etc. in support of manufacturing.  Engage Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to assure change and configuration documentation is accurate and complete, all relevant documentation is included, and appropriate implementation strategies and validation activities have been completed.  Review and monitor implementation activities to ensure the change has been completed properly.  Responsible for the accuracy of system data through process evaluation and validation.  Develop and maintain product and process configurations and collaborate on the implementation of solutions in PLM and ERP.  Identify, execute, and support process improvement initiatives of varying complexity engaging global, cross functional support.  Work with peers to ensure timely completion of projects and tasks.  Take initiative to develop and implement new processes to strengthen data accuracy or enhance efficiency.  Demonstrate effective communication style working with all levels of organizational structure, through multiple departments, and across global sites.  Provide leadership to junior engineers.  Help manage task prioritization and measure team capacity  Manage service requests and customer expectations in alignment with defined service and operational level agreements  Proactively troubleshoot and optimize application configuration and development to ensure performance and reliability  Collaborate with database teams to ensure service availability, application uptime and maintain prompt issue resolution  On call for critical deployments and escalation point for high-priority system incidents  Provide solution expertise; serve as an internal consultant to promote best in class high standard solutions in the manufacturing space  Help with management of departmental resources, staffing, mentoring and growth to build and maintain a best-of-class development team  Translate business requirements into functional requirements specifications, workflows and identifies cross-functional dependencies  Leads discussion with business and technical team to collect pain points including non-functional requirements using a structured framework  Prepares visuals to communicate and acquires buy-in on stopgaps, recommendations and solutionsRequirements:  5+ years of hands on experience as a Software Engineer or Business Analyst in MES (Camstar) or similar technology driving implementations and upgrades  5+ years of professional experience as a development lead, team lead or people manger  Experience in managing applications in a regulated environment, specially ensuring 21 CFR Part 11 Compliance  Exhibit excellent critical thinking  Bring passion to work each day and have the innate ability to inspire passion in others  Exude confidence in ability to resolve complex problems  Ability to jump into a code review and help design great software with peers  Demonstrated effective leadership and analytical skills  Ability to quickly absorb new concepts and ideas, including Illumina’s business model, incorporating regional or site-specific requirements.  Collaborate successfully with a diverse set of peers and stakeholders  Cross-cultural experience preferred  Must be an analytical thinker, comfortable taking the initiative in situations where thought leadership is either absent or unclear  Possess in-depth knowledge of ERP, MES, SAP QM/PP, SECS/GEM and LIMS systems  Experience as an industrial or process engineer or is a plus  Experience with enterprise analysis including development of solution proposals and creation of business cases  Experience with business process improvement techniques and methodologies  Exceptional analytical, planning, organizational and problem solving abilities  Expertise in requirements gathering, writing software requirements, process modeling and data mapping  Strong ability to present ideas and information in group settings.  Has the ability to persuade, negotiate, and facilitate conflict resolution.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills that non-technical end users can understand  Knowledge of the full software development life cycle using Agile/Scrum Methodology  Experience in configuration management, operations, and/or quality within a regulated industry  High degree of initiative and ownership, as well as a proven history of delivering results while working with several different departments in a fast-paced environmentEducation:  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field required, master’s degree preferredIllumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

title: Principal Software Engineer_21WD53378
description: Principal Software EngineerLocation: SingaporeJob ID: 21WD53378Position OverviewAutodesk is evolving its subscription business models and the Offer to Price team is helping ideate, plan, build and run the foundation of the company’s $2.5B+ business with an eye on scaling to meet the needs of its growth to $5B and beyond. We build engineering platforms that integrate with our customer-facing products and serve our partner ecosystem. We strive to embrace a leading edge yet pragmatic engineering focus on practices that provide consistent value to our customers, like Cloud and integration technologies, DevOps capabilities and a Disciplined agile delivery. To support this vision, we are looking for a strong Principal Engineer who has built solutions in the cloud (AWS strongly preferred). This is a great time to be a part of the team as we will be building a brand new solution related to Product creation and replication, Pricing Operations and Management, Reporting and Integrations with other systems in the landscape. This is a critical role that will lead the organization with technical expertise in building systems and procedures that meet business stakeholder requirements.Reports to: Senior Engineering Manager in Offer to Price (O2P) WorkstreamResponsibilitiesThis is a very senior role in engineering. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. title: validation lead
description: You will be a software engineer in test/validation and take the lead role in defining and directing test strategies and developing desktop applications for our Embedded Software team. You will be part of the development of software projects supplying new services for our customers in payment, banking, transport and loyalty services.RESPONSIBILITIES  Develop software test and library based on product requirements, collaborating with Technical/Project Leads, Validators and Integrators  Define and develop test cases and integration tests in order to deliver stable and robust software  Develop desktop application for efficiency and process improvement using Java and .NET framework  Write and review software test plan and strategy, benchmark, requirements and use cases clarification  Define and implement continuous integration and build  Provide innovative technical solutions  Collaborate with Project Leaders on the project to support the integration and training of the product  Provide level 3 support (ie. find root cause problems of codes, research for resolutions to unknown issues, enhancements) for products and customer projectsESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS  To succeed, you should have experience with Visual Basic in scripting style usages (other types of scripting language experience are welcomed)  Java, .NET framework, object-oriented programming  Experience leading team members to implement test cases, test libraries, benchmark test and reviewing of validation test plan and strategyGOOD TO HAVE  Background knowledge with personalization, smart cards and security including cryptography/ PKI/ Java Card  Experience with microprocessors, microcontrollers, desktop application development and security

title: MNC Java Programmer / Java Software Developer /Good Bonus

title: Cloud Platform Senior Developer - Cloud Enablement, Executive Director (69589)
description: What We DoAt Goldman Sachs, our engineers solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems in financial services via collaboration and innovation. We build parallel systems, analyzes oceans of data, architect and implement scalable and reliable infrastructure, proactively guard against cyber threats, and continuously deliver technology solutions to connect people and capital for a better economy.Engineering division is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit and lead technology possibilities? Start here.Who We AreCore Engineering provides global thought leadership, solution development, delivery and support for a broad suite of technology products and services at Goldman Sachs. It leverages global expertise to develop leading-edge technology solutions that meet business demands and differentiate the firm's technology offerings in the marketplace. Core Engineering enables the operation of the firm by managing an extensive compute platform and global communication networks, while addressing technology, compliance and reputational risk and resilience.The Cloud Enablement team within Core Engineering is responsible for enabling the use of public cloud services across the firm. You will be working as part of multi-disciplinary team responsible for researching, architecting and building a cutting-edge platform that enable Goldman Sachs teams to deploy and manage services in public cloud safely and securely. We are at an early stage of modernizing our services around cloud native principles, and you will be directly contributing to platform that programmatically enforces safety, security and compliance of services and enables engineers to innovate faster.Responsibilities and QualificationsAs part of our global Cloud Enablement team you will work on various components as a Software Engineer. Your role includes specification, development, testing and releasing of new features. The team owns the platforms throughout the lifecycle. You are expected to contribute to the vision, understand our customers’ needs, business goals, product roadmap and contribute to building an engineering culture within the team. We expect the successful candidate to deliver high quality software and to be passionate about software engineering. You must have a proficient understanding of software development, security and the mechanisms to design safe, resilient and highly-available cloud native services.HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL• Design, develop and manage services in public cloud• Architect safe, resilient and highly-available distributed services• Write technical specifications, work with several teams and manage technical dependencies and drive design meetings with various stakeholders for consensus• Partner with cloud providers such as AWS, GCP and Azure to shape the future of public cloud services for finance industrySKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR• Strong technical ability, willingness to learn and evolve your skills with advances in technology• Programming expertise in Java, Go or JavaScript• Expertise with Linux, containers, system security and automation with scripting languages• Strong leadership skills, ability to motivate team members and manage projects• Strong oral and written communication skillsPreferred Qualifications• Bachelor or Advanced Degree in Computer Science or related field• Knowledge and experience of software development lifecycle and infrastructure-as-code tooling, such as CloudFormation, Terraform, CDK or Kubernetes• Experience with security, isolation and multi-tenant design of distributed cloud services• Familiarity with software artifact and container image lifecycle management and governance• Understanding of RESTful API design best practices and experience in developing them• Technical leadership experience of 2+ yearsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

title: 7104-Application Engineer Manager [P/L (profit and loss)  | CCTV | security system | training and development of Application Engineers | up to 8.5k | MNC]
description: Position title : Application Engineer ManagerLocation: BugisWorking Days: 5 days, Mon-FriWorking hours : 9am-6pmSalary : 7,500 – 8,500Job MissionReporting to the Operation Manager, APAC, the Application Engineer Manager is responsible for the day-to-day management, training and development of Application Engineers who provide support for integration or technical projects. Help manage the P/L (profit and loss) while ensuring all client and company business needs are met.Responsibilities• Attend meetings with customers and Project Management team to analyze and determine customer system needs and provide recommendations.• Understand all customer commitments / contracts/ standards and ensure that all fulfilments are met to milestones and quality standards.• Ensure new hires are trained to comply with client standards/processes.• Work with the Design and Project Management team to engineer systems. Take over-all responsibility for estimating Application Engineering tasks during projects.• Create test plans, coordinate with commissioning team and test systems.• Create and set up the server OS, database, application, and services in line with the clients requirements.• Configure the system to continue to run in an optimal state via regular archives, backups, and maintenance.• Work with the commissioning engineers/tech to fully test and bring the system online.• Customize system to customers business model.• Work in compliance with the company's Health and Safety standards and requirements with the safety of self and others in mind at all times.• Troubleshoot system / security network related issues over the phone.• Train customers and technicians on proposed and installed systems.• Document and maintain system architecture and parameters based on customer standards.• Continue to investigate new technologies that can assist our customer base and increase our productivity.• Continue higher education in management or security industry to support management role.• Attend industry tradeshows as needed and maintain a professional working relationship with manufacturers.Managerial Responsibilities• Oversee Application Engineering team, and work together with Project Management team, to ensure client needs are met with minimal scheduling conflict.• Identify and plan for future hiring needs.• Responsible for initiating and participating in the hiring efforts for the Application Engineering team by alerting HR and Director of Professional Services of open positions.• Work with Operation Manager, APAC to ensure company strategic policy and technological consistency is achieved globally.• Work with Service/Installation Manager in creating a career path for technicians into the Application Engineering group.• Mentor Application Engineers to enhance both technical  general business management skills.• Empower Application Engineering team to keep up to date with current market developments and further their continuous professional development.• Continually improve quality and efficiency within the organization.• Schedule and coordinate Application Engineers for projects.• Responsible for approving timesheets, expense reports and PTO.• Hold regular one-on-one meetings with direct reports.• Responsible for scheduling technology training as needed.• Review RFP, RFI, RFQs and provide feedback to ensure a successful proposal.• Work with various teams to develop a statement of work.• Review team-created project plans and identify deficiencies and corrective measures.Qualifications/Skills• Bachelors degree in Computer Science or direct industry experience.• Minimum of five years managing a team of five or more direct reports.• Customer-focused with strong written and verbal communications skills• Ability to efficiently manage people multiple tasks, activities, and events simultaneously• Strong interpersonal skills and proven ability to drive results in a multicultural and global environment.• Effective ability to prioritize, provide leadership and direction to others.Required Education/ExperienceBachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineer or related field.Management experience (five years)

title: Senior Backend Engineer, FAS
description: About this positionWe are seeking a talented Senior Backend Software Engineer to help develop and roll out the next generation of our advanced tools to support autonomous driving. We are building a suite of fleet management products to enable the successful operation of our Autonomous Vehicles at scale. The core of the Fleet Autonomy Services (FAS) platform is built around our real-time data pipeline which enables our AVs to communicate with our cloud services. Our team develops products such as real-time monitoring platform for the AV fleet, vehicle software update services, and integrations with ride hailing partners.What You'll Be Doing  Design, build and maintain our FAS platform for our autonomous vehicle fleet  Write high quality, maintainable code  Assist with high-level analysis, design, and code reviews  Communicate with stakeholders and other team leads to identify system requirements  Manage product delivery timelines  Hands-on implementation of key portions of the systemWhat We're Looking For  5+ years of professional work experience as a software engineer in designing and building distributed systems  Experience with serverless architectures  Experience building systems using SQL and NoSQL databases  Strong written and oral communication skills  MS, BS or BA in Computer Science / Engineering  Comfortable working in a fast-paced, continuous delivery environment  Experience with Amazon Web Services, Docker, and TerraformBonus Points (not required)  Experience with IoT infrastructure  Experience with Python / Golang  Experience with JavaScript / React / Redux

title: Senior Robotics Engineer
description: JOB SUMMARY:OTSAW Digital is seeking creative, energetic well-rounded Robotics Software Engineer to work in the field of computer vision, machine learning, perception, and autonomous navigation. You will be responsible for integrating and testing software solutions in simulation and on the robot. We are looking for engineers who are interested in tackling challenging problems for our security and surveillance robots. At OTSAW Digital, we want people with passion. We want innovators. We want people who can collaborate and bring us a creative future. So, if you are passionate about working in a startup, want to solve hard problems and make cool robots with us, please apply.Responsibilities:· Develop software system for localization, object detection  tracking, control of the robot· In charge one of the following domains:· Computer Vision algorithm – object detection  classification, lane tracking· Localization algorithm based on Lidar, Camera, GPS· Build tiles  vector map to support localization, path planner· Sensor fusion algorithm for reliable, precise localization, object tracking· Embedded System – low level interfacing with sensors, actuators· Model robot control system, low-level motion planning algorithm· Behavior planning – path planning  mission control· Simulation – for testing of robot behavior  path plannerRequirements:· Min. education qualification in Bachelor Degree in Robotics Engineer or other Engineering related course· Strong theoretical  practical experience in developing perception and/or control algorithm· Demonstrate deep interest  understanding in relevant domain of interest· Experience in developing on actual physical robot· Experience in C++, Python, ROS, Git

We provide IT solutions to our business counterparts for internal management reporting and external regulatory reporting (MAS, HKMA, APRA, BOJ, etc.)Your expertise :• technical Analyst / software engineer / developer focused on developing regulatory/financial/internal reporting solutions within the finance sector• experience with Axiom ControllerView is preferred – but willing to train the right candidate• familiar with ETL tools like Informatica• strong experience with front to back regulatory reporting implementations• strong experience with data warehousing, SQL, PL/SQL on Oracle databases• experience with Big Data technologies like Spark, SPARK SQL, Databricks using Scala or Python• familiar with SDLC and software development best practices, including version control and CI/CD• experience with Agile Methodology, Scrum Methodology.• design, plan and deliver solutions in a large-scale enterprise environment• bachelor’s/master’s degree or equivalent with a focus in computer science or engineering

title: Senior Support Engineer
description: As a Senior Software Engineer, Support in the Backend Chapter, you will be responsible for supporting and operating applications that run in the cloud or in the data centre to support both web and mobile apps in a model approach.  Using engineering best practices, the applications you support and operate will be the highest availability with public traffic and active users and confirm to production operation standards.The applications you work with will be primarily written in the Java programming language with specialized services written in other languages such as JavaScript or Golang, Python, etc.You will understand service implementation approaches that support consistent and eventually-consistent data models using synchronous and asynchronous techniques and understand the fundamentals of resource optimization and concurrency.You will understand how and contribute to the support and operation of highly scalable applications running in both the cloud and on-premise data centres and the principles of micro-services.You will be expected with programming skills and good practicing the software engineering, CI/CD, automation, reducing Toil, and operating with SOPs under your ownership.Key Responsibilities  Stand by on-call and provide technical support by checking systems logs, dashboards, or monitoring tools.  In charge of services from deployment, operation, and monitoring  Support services capacity planning, production deployment, launch reviews, and product support  Monitor availability, latency, and overall health in the end-to-end flow  Practice root cause analysis and report with an objective view and blameless culture  Development of High-Performance Java Service API and Business Systems  Working with AWS Services to optimize your Java applications (SQS, SNS, SES, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, RDS, and more)  Mentor and help engineers to grow and become better engineers  Ensure best practices are followed in the ChapterRequirements  BA in Computer Science or Computer Engineering  Min 6 years or relevant working experience in Software Engineering  Tech stack: Java 8 / Java lambda, Spring Boot, RESTFul API / JSON, HTTP Protocols / CORS / CSRF, Cache Control (Redis), SQL Database, Microservice Architectures, Containerization, Maven / Gradle, Unix/Linux (Or Windows Server) operating systems, Configuration management tools like Ansible, Puppet or Chef, Monitoring stacks Prometheus, Grafana, Elasticsearch and APM tools like Dynatrace, AppDynamics, etc., Web Server, and Java Application Server, CI / CD (optional), NoSQL (optional)  Deep understanding of complex business processes  Deep understanding of support and operation processes, for example, L1/L2/L3 across department teams  Deep understanding of Algorithmic Design  Deep understanding of Software Development Lifecycles  Can work in diverse large teams  Ability to communicate effectively

If you are looking to collaborate with highly motivated peers, and immerse in best industrial practices, or if you have a deep passion for contributing to the public good, this is the right opportunity for you.What To Expect:  Design, develop, document, test, deploy, and maintain software applications.  Improve software quality using Scrum practices such as code review and unit testing. Working experience in Agile and UX development environments will be an added advantage.  Good presentation and listening skills.  Self-driven, motivated, and strong desire to learn.

title: Analyst Programmer / Systems Analyst (Digital Solutions Department) [NIE]
description: The National Institute of Education (NIE) invites suitable candidates to join the Division of Academic Computing  Information Services (ACIS) as an Analyst Programmer/Systems Analyst. The candidate should be a dynamic IT professional who is a good team player and a passionate software developer. In NIE’s digital solutions department, we will also take in aspiring software developers with good technical ability and train them to take on innovative enterprise-grade solutions.Job DescriptionAs a member of the Digital Solutions department, your responsibilities include:  Work as part of a team to develop and support NIE’s corporate portal and corporate mobile.  Work on innovative solutions with team lead (solution architect) such as App Containerisation and API gateway.  Collaborate with IT teams to determine the scope and expectations of the project to align with infrastructure and info security policies.  Focus on good code quality and high-test coverage and participate in code reviews.  Integrate software components and third-party programs to meet specifications.  Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing applications.Required abilities and skills:  A University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.  2 to 3 years of experience as a software developer, software engineer, or similar role.  Robust knowledge of coding languages (e.g. .Net, Java, Python, Node.Js, React.Js).  Relevant experience with relational and NoSQL databases and Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) frameworks (e.g., Hibernate).  Quick learner who is passionate and willing to learn new languages and technologies.  Must be able to multitask and work well under pressure.  Good self-motivated team player with a positive attitude and flexibility in adapting to changes.  A good problem-solving attitude.  Ability to work with tight deadlines and fluid requirements.  The following skillsets will put Applicants in a more favourable position:a. Knowledge in Low Code Platform (e.g., Outsystems);b. Knowledge in API development/integration and API platforms;c. Knowledge in RPA (Robotic Process Automation) tool (e.g., UIPath);d. Knowledge of mobile development using Microsoft Xamarin;e. Knowledge of AI/ML platforms.Closing DateThe closing date of the advertisement is 25 November 2021. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.Other InformationNIE staff can take chartered buses at their own expense from or near their homes to NIE campus. This is subject to the availability of seats.

title: AWM Brokerage Technology Senior Developer
description: Job DescriptionAs a member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You’ll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment—one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.Brokerage Derivatives Trading  Regulations Technology team develop applications for end to end trade lifecycle management including trade capture and control workflow to position booking, trade reporting and confirmations. As a senior software engineer in the team, you will be part of multi-year program, working alongside diverse team in Singapore globally aligned with business stakeholders redefining the entire booking flow for Derivatives in the Private Bank.This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:  Strong Java Development skills with 7+ years of experience in solving business problems having exposure to performance tuning, low latency, and multithreading  2+ years of experience with big data tools Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.  Strong Agile development background and experience with TDD/BDD concepts and testing skills  Strong problem-solving skills and understanding of data structures  algorithms  Some exposure to Cloud (AWS / Cloud Foundry) would be needed to succeed in the role  Some experience in data modeling, visualization, and reporting techniques like QlikSense  BS/BA degree  Advanced knowledge of application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines  Understanding of architecture and design across all systems  Working proficiency in developmental toolsets  Knowledge of industry-wide technology trends and best practices  Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals  Passionate about building an innovative culture  Proficiency in one or more modern programming languages  Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance, and software improvementAbout UsJ.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.About the TeamJ.P. Morgan Asset  Wealth Management delivers industry-leading investment management and private banking solutions with client assets of $4 trillion. Asset Management provides individuals, advisors and institutions with strategies and expertise that span the full spectrum of asset classes through our global network of investment professionals. Wealth Management helps individuals, families and foundations take a more intentional approach to their wealth or finances to better define, focus and realize their goals.Our Asset and Wealth Management division is driven by innovators like you who are driven to create technology solutions that make us work more efficiently and help our businesses grow. It’s our mission to efficiently take care of our clients’ wealth, helping them get, and remain properly invested. Our team of agile technologists thrive in a cloud-native environment that values continuous learning using a data-centric approach in developing innovative technology solutions.

title: AWM Brokerage Technology Junior Developer
description: As a member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You’ll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment—one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.Brokerage Derivatives Trading  Regulations Technology team develop applications for end to end trade lifecycle management including trade capture and control workflow to position booking, trade reporting and confirmations. As a senior software engineer in the team, you will be part of multi-year program, working alongside diverse team in Singapore globally aligned with business stakeholders redefining the entire booking flow for Derivatives in the Private Bank.This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:  Strong Java Development skills with 4+ years of experience in solving business problems having exposure to performance tuning, low latency, and multithreading   2+ years of experience with front-end technologies  Strong Agile development background and experience with TDD/BDD concepts and testing skills   Strong problem-solving skills and understanding of data structures  algorithms  Some exposure to Cloud (AWS / Cloud Foundry) would be needed to succeed in the role  Some experience in data modeling, visualization, and reporting techniques like QlikSense is a plus  BS/BA degree  Advanced knowledge of application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines  Understanding of architecture and design across all systems  Working proficiency in developmental toolsets  Knowledge of industry-wide technology trends and best practices  Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals  Passionate about building an innovative culture  Proficiency in one or more modern programming languages  Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance, and software improvementAbout UsJ.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.About the TeamJ.P. Morgan Asset  Wealth Management delivers industry-leading investment management and private banking solutions with client assets of $4 trillion. Asset Management provides individuals, advisors and institutions with strategies and expertise that span the full spectrum of asset classes through our global network of investment professionals. Wealth Management helps individuals, families and foundations take a more intentional approach to their wealth or finances to better define, focus and realize their goals.Our Asset and Wealth Management division is driven by innovators like you who are driven to create technology solutions that make us work more efficiently and help our businesses grow. It’s our mission to efficiently take care of our clients’ wealth, helping them get, and remain properly invested. Our team of agile technologists thrive in a cloud-native environment that values continuous learning using a data-centric approach in developing innovative technology solutions.

title: Manager Commercial Solution Architecture & Integration CoP
description: Manager Commercial Solution Architecture  Integration CoP· Work in a high-performing team building strategic technology for a growing business· Opportunity to use contemporary software development tools and techniques· Contribute meaningfully to the outcome of the customer· Based in Singapore, global commercial hub for Rio Tinto ​About the roleOur new Commercial Services  Digital team will streamline and guide how we invest in and harness technology for Commercial. This team will modernise and digitise our manual processes, addressing pain points for employees and focus on initiatives for improving customer experiences. We see Commercial Services as the engine room with their focus on post deal tasks such as invoicing, trade finance, shipping and laytime. Commercial Services  Digital is a unique opportunity to bring digital closer to the business, to create more synergies between teams and bring together business improvements to achieve business excellence.​We’re looking for an experienced Manager Commercial Solution Architecture and Integration CoP to be accountable for overseeing all solution architecture and integration activity and solution architect resources across Commercial Digital. Enable a high level of performance and standards across product delivery that is leading in my domain.​The team does this by using modern techniques, tooling and behaviours to deliver software as quickly as possible. You’ll build on the culture, values and engineering principles that has made the team successful, reinforcing the speed and agility achieved thus far by taking a principled approach in software design. You’ll be asked to learn new things quickly and accomplish a wide range of tasks, all focused on designing technology solutions covering transactional activity, market risk and credit risk analysis.​Reporting to the Senior Manager Innovation  CoP, you will be:​· Set the vision, purpose and cadence of the Commercial Solution Architecture and Integration CoP.· Develop and disseminate domain-specific best practices, guidelines, knowledge and lessons learned for commercial solution architect resources to draw on to deliver a high level of performance and standards across product delivery.· Promote collaboration, innovation, sharing of information and development of domain-specific skills within CoP.· Accountable for overseeing and supporting the solution architecture and platform integration activity across Commercial Digital, including delivery.· Accountable for people managing Principal/Senior Advisor Commercial Solution Architects (internal and external resources) including performance management, capacity planning and coordination of resources to address demand (in collaboration with the Governance, Portfolio and RAD Team).· Champion and inspire a growth mindset, and pave career progression pathways for the team.· Lead change efforts to embed new ways of working within team.· Responsible for partnering with other CoP Managers (with relevant disciplines in solution architecture and platform integration) across Rio Tinto.· Accountable for leading a project to establish the platform landscape within Commercial, then once established accountable for overseeing the ongoing maintenance, monitoring, integration and improvement of these platforms.What you will need for the roleTo succeed in this role, you will have:· Around 15 years relevant experience as an architect or software engineer in a trading environment· Ability to implement models in Python, R, VBA/Excel, Matlab or other technical computing language to demonstrate or articulate requirements· Demonstrated ability to work both with senior business stakeholders as well as software engineers, translating requirements and fostering a culture of product delivery· Demonstrated ability to piece together an application landscape across a complex business process, design technical solutions from scratch and usher through to deployment· Professional experience working with risk concepts such as VaR, volatility surfaces, non-linear product valuation, potential future exposure, Monte Carlo simulation and the like· Good understanding of a wide variety of linear and non-linear financial instruments and markets including futures, vanilla options, swaps, forwards, exotics and structured products· Good understanding of cloud native architectures and design, specifically AWS services such as S3, Lambda, EC2, RDS (Postgres), API Gateway and Fargate· Excitement about trading and financial markets and motivated to learn and explore​It would also be beneficial if you have:· Advanced knowledge and coding abilities in Python and other lower level languages (e.g. C++)· Experience using SQL to query and manipulate large data sets​Where you will be workingRio Tinto Commercial puts the company’s value over volume approach into practice, with the goal of maximizing the value of our physical flows to improve both our business and that of our customers.  Headquartered in Singapore, and integrated with Rio Tinto’s assets, hubs, and offices globally, our Commercial group works hand-in-hand with our product groups to ensure both the amount and types of products we produce meet our customer’s needs, and manage the trade-off between volumes, quality, cost and capital expenditure. ​About usAs pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.Aluminium for cars and smartphones. Copper for wind turbines, electric cars and the pipes that bring water to our home. Iron ore to shape our city skylines. Borates that help crops grow, titanium for paint – and diamonds that celebrate the best things in life.Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents.​Creating an inclusive and diverse workforceWe are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.​​Please note, in order to be considered for a role you must complete all pre-screening questions.“Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove job postings prior to the stated closing date, therefore, if you are interested in applying for this vacancy please submit your application as soon as possible.”

title: Software Engineering Lead
description: We are looking for passionate and driven software  engineers to join our fast-growing global tech team in Singapore. We are  a very dynamic team of Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Consultants,  Software Engineers, Sales and Marketing.  Work closely with the Product Management, Data Engineering and Data  Scientists team to design, prototype and build new products and features  to the ongoing development.  Take part in requirement analysis, software design, follow TDD  practices to perform tests and develop the modules, APIs and frontend  apps.  Apply best practices to what you do and share the knowledge with the team.  Work in a development team that follows the best practices of Agile and SCRUM to achieve tasks in a given sprint.This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Software Engineer  who wants to make a difference and who wants to join us on this journey  to take our company to the next chapter of its growth.Requirements  Degree in Computer Science or equivalent  At least 5 years of prior working experience and expertise in Full-Stack development using NodeJS and ReactJS is essential. Experience working with ECS, Docker and Kubernetes and with  experience with CI tools like Bitbucket pipelines or Jenkins (this is a  bonus!)  Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well with others

title: Senior Systems Developer
description: ResponsibilitiesResponsible for the planning, design and implementation of infrastructure management system for cloud and self-hosted environment. In this role, you will need to config and build software used for the management of IT infrastructure components, from network to operating system, middleware, databases and IOT devices using coding and scripts. You will also develop software and scripts to automate manual tasks required for service fulfilment and assurance. You will also be in charge of the deployment of various technologies used.  Translate business requirement to technical specification  Create Implementation Plan  Build and maintain automation scripts and application code for automating tasks for infrastructure management such and provisioning, troubleshooting, resolution, configuration change, compliance check  Build, deploy and release OSS component packages using automation technologies.  Understand the design template for public cloud such as Amazon Web Service and Azure, develop the necessary scripts to build and deploy resources in the private cloud.  Build software to integrate with managed components, extract data required for monitoring and management. Configure infrastructure management tools  Define and ensure quality control with strict adherence to standards, policies and procedures  Create test plan and support user acceptance test  Create system configuration and operation documentation  Manage outsourced implementation resources  Ensure secured coding best practices are adhered toRequirements  Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent  Minimum 7 years’ experience as a system / software engineer  Knowledge in Cloud technology such as AWS / Azure  Experience in Python and/or Javascript, Ansible, Powershell  Integration using Web Services  Integration with Database  Agile methodology  Database design  Linux and Windows operating system  Good understanding of networking technology  Understanding of Datalake technology  Knowledge in system management software such as Nagios, Zabbix, CA UIM.  Knowledge in DevOps technologies and experience in building CI/CD pipeline  Experience in customizing and configuration visualization tool such as Grafana and / or Tableau
